timeline.message:
Map some 20w15a new classes (entities, enchantments)

Signed-off-by: liach <liach@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: Sounds like you said the same thing twice
timeline.author: YanisBft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,3 @@
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_5150 net/minecraft/item/Vanishable
+	COMMENT Represents a type of item that can have the "curse of vanishing", or the
+	COMMENT {@code minecraft:vanishing_curse}, enchantment.

replies.bodyText: the displayed name isn't the same as the id, so I said the thing twice. And someone think it is actually unintuitive.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: It's on that list because it's inconsistent, not necessarily unintuitive. No-one finds that name unintuitive. And besides, you don't need to reference something by its ID if it already has a name. On the rare occasion you need an ID you can look it up in the Enchantments class.
replies.author: Earthcomputer

timeline.bodyText: Again, sounds like you said the same thing twice
timeline.author: YanisBft
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@ +CLASS net/minecraft/class_5151 net/minecraft/item/Wearable + COMMENT Represents a type of item that is wearable in an armor equipment slot. + COMMENT + COMMENT

This type of item can be targeted by the "curse of bindng", or the + COMMENT {@code minecraft:binding_curse}, enchantment.
